issue.title: Monitor New Albums :: No longer working [Lidarr v1.2.3.3254]

labels.name: Type: Bug
labels.description: Issue is a bug

labels.name: Status: Needs Triage
labels.description: New Issue needing triage

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing open and closed issues

### Current Behavior

Lidarr is no longer monitoring new albums. 

When you have "download monitored albums" selected, and monitor set to "new albums", the new album will get added to the artist's page, but it will not be monitored. Therefore, new releases are not being automatically downloaded when available.

### Expected Behavior

Expect new albums to be monitored, and then downloaded when available.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Had a friend add a new album for [an artist on Musicbrainz.org](https://musicbrainz.org/artist/7e81433c-d382-496c-9a5b-0216d14f12c3)
2. That artist is set to download monitored albums, and monitor albums is set to "new"
3. Lidarr RSS Update runs
4. Manual refresh artist, [album gets added](https://musicbrainz.org/release-group/5af2a4d4-a432-45c0-8858-e71ccfd76c1a), but Lidarr does not monitor it.

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Synology DSM 7.1.1-42962
- Lidarr: 1.2.3.3254
- Docker Install: Yes
- Using Reverse Proxy: No.
- Browser: Chrome Version 114.0.5735.90 (Mac)
- Database: Sqlite 3.40.1
```


### What branch are you running?

Nightly

### Trace Logs?

Unfortunately, I forgot to change my logs from debug to trace before doing this test. I will have to find another artist with a missing album on MBZ, then run this test again with trace logs on. Once I do that, I will update my logs from Debug to Trace. But for now, here are the Debug logs at least:

https://privatebin.net/?833a167bdbc49b57#3P37nrFmXAVbJqrKMKUCURsY6LAoUDXFdABpRxZioCH5

### Trace Logs have been provided as applicable. Reports may be closed if the required logs are not provided.

- [X] I have followed the steps in the wiki link above and provided the required trace logs that are relevant and show this issue.

comment.body: Yup. As well as many others. I regularly have to go in and manually click the monitor button if I actually want it to monitor new albums. It’s been this way for about a year now. Can’t remember when I first reported it. Might be longer now…

When you have "download monitored albums" selected, and monitor set to "new albums", the new album will get added to the artist's page, but it will not be monitored. Therefore, new releases are not being automatically downloaded when available.

### Expected Behavior

Expect new albums to be monitored, and then downloaded when available.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Had a friend add a new album for [an artist on Musicbrainz.org](https://musicbrainz.org/artist/7e81433c-d382-496c-9a5b-0216d14f12c3)
2. That artist is set to download monitored albums, and monitor albums is set to "new"
3. Lidarr RSS Update runs
4. Manual refresh artist, [album gets added](https://musicbrainz.org/release-group/5af2a4d4-a432-45c0-8858-e71ccfd76c1a), but Lidarr does not monitor it.

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Synology DSM 7.1.1-42962
- Lidarr: 1.2.3.3254
- Docker Install: Yes
- Using Reverse Proxy: No.
- Browser: Chrome Version 114.0.5735.90 (Mac)
- Database: Sqlite 3.40.1
```


### What branch are you running?

Nightly

### Trace Logs?

Unfortunately, I forgot to change my logs from debug to trace before doing this test. I will have to find another artist with a missing album on MBZ, then run this test again with trace logs on. Once I do that, I will update my logs from Debug to Trace. But for now, here are the Debug logs at least:

https://privatebin.net/?833a167bdbc49b57#3P37nrFmXAVbJqrKMKUCURsY6LAoUDXFdABpRxZioCH5

### Trace Logs have been provided as applicable. Reports may be closed if the required logs are not provided.

- [X] I have followed the steps in the wiki link above and provided the required trace logs that are relevant and show this issue.

issue.title: Full Rescan trigged by Manually importing single album

labels.name: Type: Bug
labels.description: Issue is a bug

labels.name: Status: Needs Triage
labels.description: New Issue needing triage

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing open and closed issues

### Current Behavior

This is a bit frustrating after many years people raising the issue of needing a workaround for the buggy rescan logic.  That said, perhaps it's something unique to me.

If I go to the wanted section and do a manual import of a single album, let it match automatically, choose replace existing files, then import, the system triggers a full rescan of 108000 files which takes over an hour.  No more albums can be fully imported manually until the rescan is finished, specifically, I am able to queue them up, however it will import the queue at the end of the scan, after which I import more, an additional full rescan is triggered and I must wait another hour before anything queued up appears in my library.  I assume this is happening with basically all imports which is putting an unnecessary load on my system.

I am running nightly but I haven't been able to confirm if that's bugged out so instead for now I'll record the version here, in case it's really old or something.  I mean this stuff is supposed to be fixed right?

As far as I can tell, I'm keeping up with latest as I have version nightly 1.1.4.2998 and the last stable version according to GitHub was 1.02.2592 from 2022.

I'm using the linuxserver.io docker container.  Other than this I'd say Lidarr works very well.

Other related issues that came up while searching for a fix below - work has clearly been done.

Allow rescan to be stopped: https://github.com/lidarr/Lidarr/issues/1105
More rescan fixes: https://github.com/Lidarr/Lidarr/pull/1540

### Expected Behavior

I should be able to manually import an album, have it show up in my library without having to wait for a full rescan every time.

### Steps To Reproduce

1 Go to wanted section of lidarr
2 click manual import
3 Change to replace existing files
4 click import


### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Unraid
- Lidarr:  1.1.4.2998
- Docker Install: Yes
- Using Reverse Proxy: No
- Browser: Safari
- Database: Sqlite 3.40.1
```


### What branch are you running?

Nightly

### Trace Logs?

I'll provide these once the current scan has finished as obviously restarting will just trigger it all again.  Give me a few hours.

comment.body: My problem is when it imports the files are at zero. so the artist is there... the albums I have has a flag next to it... but says 0/23 for example. I do a manual import of one artist and they all show up. BUT guess what? I do not see how to do a manual import of all my files... so what is it scanning over and over?

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing open and closed issues

### Current Behavior

I did a fresh install of Lidarr and ran into the following:

1. Add music folder ; Set it to only monitor future releases/
2.  Let it scan.
3. Notice about 20 albums with something missing/incorrect things in the wanted section; Which is odd on its own considering i only want to monitor future albums.
4. After the initial run it seems to start the "rescan folders" task and throwing errors. For example:

MediaFileDeletionService failed while processing [TrackFileDeletedEvent]: Could not find a part of the path '/music/The Offspring (American punk)'.
System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Could not find a part of the path '/music/The Offspring (American punk)'.
   at System.IO.Enumeration.FileSystemEnumerator`1.CreateDirectoryHandle(String path, Boolean ignoreNotFound)
   at System.IO.Enumeration.FileSystemEnumerator`1.Init()
   at System.IO.Enumeration.FileSystemEnumerableFactory.UserFiles(String directory, String expression, EnumerationOptions options)
   at System.IO.Directory.InternalEnumeratePaths(String path, String searchPattern, SearchTarget searchTarget, EnumerationOptions options)
   at System.IO.Directory.GetFiles(String path, String searchPattern, EnumerationOptions enumerationOptions)
   at NzbDrone.Core.MediaFiles.MediaFileDeletionService.Handle(TrackFileDeletedEvent message) in D:\a\1\s\src\NzbDrone.Core\MediaFiles\MediaFileDeletionService.cs:line 199
   at NzbDrone.Core.Messaging.Events.EventAggregator.PublishEvent[TEvent](TEvent event)

This despite having the artist folder name setting as "{Artist Name}"

### Expected Behavior

Scan my database and after initial scan remain the same amount of wanted albums; But actually just the future albums

### Steps To Reproduce

See above

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Ubuntu 20.04
- Lidarr:1.1.3.2982
- Docker Install: yes (compose)
- Using Reverse Proxy: No
- Browser: Chrome (no UI problem)
- Database: Sqlite 3.40.1
```


### What branch are you running?

Develop

### Trace Logs?

[v1.1.3.2982] System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Could not find a part of the path '/music/Slipknot (US metal band)'.
   at System.IO.Enumeration.FileSystemEnumerator`1.CreateDirectoryHandle(String path, Boolean ignoreNotFound)

   at System.IO.Directory.InternalEnumeratePaths(String path, String searchPattern, SearchTarget searchTarget, EnumerationOptions options)
   at System.IO.Directory.GetFiles(String path, String searchPattern, EnumerationOptions enumerationOptions)
   at NzbDrone.Core.MediaFiles.MediaFileDeletionService.Handle(TrackFileDeletedEvent message) in D:\a\1\s\src\NzbDrone.Core\MediaFiles\MediaFileDeletionService.cs:line 199
   at NzbDrone.Core.Messaging.Events.EventAggregator.PublishEvent[TEvent](TEvent event)

issue.title: Ignore or Hide feature in unmapped Files area

labels.name: Type: Feature Request
labels.description: Issue is a feature request.

labels.name: Status: Needs Triage
labels.description: New Issue needing triage

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

There are a few albums that are not being recognized by lidarr even though they are in MusicBrainz.  When trying to a lidarr:musicbrainzid search the search doesnt return any results.  Other IDs return results though.  There are also one off singles that do not show up either ( like comdey skits from comedians ) that i want to keep in the folder but dont need them matched in lidarr.  Example Album that lidarr doesnt find:  lidarr:31cf435b-58e8-477e-98b0-e3d1c25e78c4

The main reason for this ask is so that its easy to tell when clicking on the Unmapped files if any albums added recently have files that were not mapped in.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Like the mass delete button i saw mentioned in another feature request, a simple ignore button, either mass or if easier, per file like the delete button is on the unmapped files page ( via the wrench ).  Not sure if this would require a filter feature to be added so you could see them again ( probably a better way to handle it ) just in case whatever was stopping the match was fixed or items were added to musicbrainz later and now match.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Havent considered any alternatives cause it makes sense to leave the files with the artist name ( keep them together ).  I dont see the point in creating a different folder tree to hold stuff for an artist that isnt matching in lidarr. 

### Anything else?

Nope ( found that the Date added does save, i must have been swapping between windows/sessions )

[AB#2221](https://dev.azure.com/Servarr/7ab38f4e-5a57-4d70-84f4-94dd9bc5d6df/_workitems/edit/2221)

comment.body: This 'unmapped Files' option is dangerous, without any warning it delete my complete music library!  (No worries I have 3,2,1 backups) but still annoying.

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing open and closed issues

### Current Behavior

I did a fresh install of Lidarr and ran into the following:

1. Add music folder ; Set it to only monitor future releases/
2.  Let it scan.
3. Notice about 20 albums with something missing/incorrect things in the wanted section; Which is odd on its own considering i only want to monitor future albums.
4. After the initial run it seems to start the "rescan folders" task and throwing errors. For example:

MediaFileDeletionService failed while processing [TrackFileDeletedEvent]: Could not find a part of the path '/music/The Offspring (American punk)'.
System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Could not find a part of the path '/music/The Offspring (American punk)'.

   at NzbDrone.Core.Messaging.Events.EventAggregator.PublishEvent[TEvent](TEvent event)

This despite having the artist folder name setting as "{Artist Name}"

### Expected Behavior

Scan my database and after initial scan remain the same amount of wanted albums; But actually just the future albums

### Steps To Reproduce

See above

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Ubuntu 20.04
- Lidarr:1.1.3.2982
```
